subDimensions.name: Cross-functional Collaboration
levels: Teams operate in silos, no shared goals.
Basic cross-team discussions occur, but misalignment remains.
Regular standups, retrospectives, and shared decision-making.
Dev, Ops, and Security work together seamlessly.
Fully autonomous, product-aligned teams drive innovation together.

subDimensions.name: Shared Responsibility & Ownership
levels: Dev and Ops teams work separately.
Some shared tools but independent workflows.
Co-owned deployment and incident response.
Full accountability for deployment and production health.
“You Build It, You Run It” philosophy embedded in culture.

subDimensions.name: Leadership Buy-in & Sponsorship
levels: No leadership support for DevOps.
Leadership acknowledges DevOps but takes no action.
Leadership provides budget and high-level support.
Leadership actively embeds DevOps principles into strategy.
Executives personally drive DevOps transformation and improvement.

subDimensions.name: Blameless Postmortems
levels: No structured postmortems; blame culture exists.
Some postmortems, but teams avoid accountability.
Regular postmortems with actionable takeaways.
Blameless postmortems drive continuous improvement.
Teams proactively learn from incidents without fear.

subDimensions.name: Change Management & Governance
levels: Manual approvals slow releases.
Basic automated approvals but governance is manual.
Standardised governance with streamlined risk-based approvals.
Automated risk analysis and self-service governance.
Fully automated governance processes with AI-driven decision-making.

subDimensions.name: Incident Response & Resilience Engineering
levels: No formal incident response plan.
Teams track incidents manually.
Incident response plans documented and regularly tested.
Automated alerts and proactive monitoring.
AI-driven, self-healing infrastructure with automated incident resolution.

subDimensions.name: Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
levels: Manual infrastructure provisioning.
Some scripts for automation but still manual setup.
Fully automated, version-controlled infrastructure.
Immutable infrastructure with declarative configurations.
AI-driven self-healing infrastructure.

subDimensions.name: Automated Testing & Quality Assurance
levels: All testing is manual.
Some unit testing automated.
CI/CD integrated with full automated testing.
Security and performance tests automated.
AI-driven, predictive test automation.

subDimensions.name: CI/CD Pipeline Maturity
levels: Manual builds, deployments, and releases.
Some CI/CD automation, but processes remain inconsistent.
CI/CD pipelines automated with rollback mechanisms.
Feature flags and progressive delivery implemented.
AI-driven autonomous deployments with zero downtime.

subDimensions.name: Logging & Telemetry
levels: No structured logging.
Basic logs captured, but no proactive monitoring.
Logs centralised, alerts defined.
Distributed tracing and anomaly detection.
AI-powered self-healing monitoring.

subDimensions.name: Cloud & Hybrid Infrastructure
levels: On-prem infrastructure, no containers.
Basic cloud adoption, but still traditional models.
Containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
Multi-cloud, service mesh, hybrid strategy.
Fully serverless architecture with intelligent scaling.

subDimensions.name: DevSecOps Integration
levels: Security checked manually at end of development.
Basic security scans included in CI/CD.
Automated security scanning and shift-left security.
Real-time security analysis with risk scoring.
AI-driven threat detection and security automation.
